item.title: Saving planet Earth
item.description: Atmosphere is what allows life on Earth, it’s a layer of gases surrounding the planet that is retained by the planet’s gravity. Carbon dioxide is the most significant long-lived gas in our atmosphere which is responsible for life on Earth. Without carbon dioxide the light from the sun falling on earth would simply bounce back into space, while the presence of carbon dioxide absorbs the light from sun and allow heating the planet for life to exist.

item.title: HTTP/3 - HTTP over QUIC
item.description: As I am sipping down my morning coffee and read my Twitter feed, my app is making multiple API calls over HTTPS to Twitter’s servers somewhere on the Internet. Those HTTPS connections are running over TCP via my home WiFi and broadband connection. All’s well, the WiFi connection has the least inference, the broadband connection is stable and so there’s no packet loss. Those are perfect conditions for HTTPS running over TCP.

About Me Hi! I am Deepansh Sood. I was born in 1995 and spent most of my youth in Himachal Pradesh, India. I currently live in Bengaluru and write code for companies such as Wipro CRS and previously Ants Digital. Before that I studied Computer Science at Amity University. Did I tell you the things I like? I have been fascinated by computers since my childhood and recently found myself involved with learning Rust and Haskell.
